comment: Dude, Kate is one of my favorite professors in KSU history. I took her AMST 3740 course, which was highly discussion-based, where students would bounce off each other's ideas. In terms of course work, it was on the heavy side with either a 500 word discussion or a paper every week, etc. but if you let her know you're stressed, she WILL help you.

AMST 3740: Kate is a wonderful professor as well as such a kind person. The class was made up of engaging with different types of media- novels, artwork, music, film- and writing discussion posts relating to dystopia. It is very easy to make an A in this class, just do your discussion post every week, come to class and you'll do great. Enjoy it!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Caring

comment: Research project step-by-step & professional prep (resume, cover letter, elevator pitch)
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: So. Much. Reading. Do not take her if youre looking for an easy, get it all done in one night class. If you have a full time job along with school, dont take her. Shes also a tough grader. I got As on everything but that was only after spending every single night working on her assignments.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: Kate is awesome! Super easy class, but important content. As long as you show up ready to participate and do the work assigned, you'll do well and actually learn a good bit. I'm taking another class with Kate this semester because I enjoyed this one so much.
Schaab is your only choice, but she's not the worst. Very easy material and she genuinely cares.

She is a very hard grader for an into class. Does not stop talking, and continues to try and get class participation when there is nothing to participate in. She works past time almost everyday so having a class directly after hers is difficult.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--GROUP PROJECTS
